item.title: This Official Zelda-Themed Wireless Controller Is Only $25 At Amazon For Black Friday
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/this-official-zelda-themed-wireless-controller-is-only-25-at-amazon-for-black-friday/1100-6528017/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

The Legend of Zelda fans can score a pretty sweet deal on a wireless Nintendo Switch controller themed around the iconic action-adventure series. As part of Amazon's Black Friday Sale, PowerA's Legend of Zelda: Sworn Protector Bluetooth Controller is discounted to only $25, which is the best price yet for the $45 controller.

PowerA Wireless Switch Controller - Zelda: Sworn Protector

$25 (was $45)

Officially licensed by Nintendo, the Sworn Protector controller design is themed around Link's best-known weapons. The Hylian Shield and Master Sword from Ocarina of Time are emblazoned on the left grip. The off-white base color is accented by blue face buttons and triggers that match Link's shield. The red Hylian Crest in the center of the controller is a nice touch.

As for its technical features, the controller has two back buttons that can be remapped on the fly, which is a nice perk, especially in this price range. Since it connects via Bluetooth, you can also use it on PC and mobile devices. The controller does have an unusual quirk, though: It's powered by AA batteries. Your first pair is included, and you should get roughly 30 hours of playtime before you need to swap them out. Plus, you could always opt for rechargeable batteries, such as this Energizer kit with four batteries included for only $15 (50% off).

Third-party Switch controllers don't have NFC readers for Amiibo or HD rumble--this controller lacks rumble altogether. And while some PowerA Switch controllers have motion controls, this one does not.

If you want all of those features, you'll need to opt for Nintendo's Switch Pro Controller, which is on sale for $50 at multiple major retailers as part of Nintendo's official Black Friday deals. The Pro Controller is almost never discounted from its $70 price, so this best-ever deal is worth considering, too. You can also grab a pair of Neon Red and Blue Joy-Con Controllers for $60, down from $80.

Black Friday Zelda Merch Deals

The Legend of Zelda fans can also save on a wide variety of cool T-Shirts, hoodies, hats, and select collectibles. One of the standout deals is almost sold out: the Collector's Edition Hylian Shield statue from First 4 Figures. This 11.5-inch replica statue is made of PVC and comes with a magnetic display stand equipped with LED lights. This statue originally sold for $110, but you can add it to your display shelf for only $47.

A new Sonic movie is racing into theaters soon, and the best way to prepare for it is with a Black Friday discount on the recently released Sonic X Shadow Generations. For anyone who grew up with Sonic games in the 2010s specifically, this is a lovely remaster of 2011's Sonic Generations coupled with a brand-new campaign starring Shadow the Hedgehog. Sonic X Shadow Generations cost $50 when it launched exactly one month ago, but you can score it for just $30 on Switch, PS5, or Xbox Series X.

And if you want to rewatch the first two Sonic films before heading to the theater, Amazon has Sonic's 2-Film Collection on Blu-ray for only $16. Alternatively, you can score 4K editions of each film with limited-edition steelbook cases for only $24.85. To round out your collection, you can get Paramount's Knuckles miniseries on Blu-ray with a steelbook case for $28.79.

Sonic X Shadow Generations

$30 (was $50)

Sonic X Shadow Generations includes two games. First is a remaster of Sonic Generations, which is a celebration of Sonic throughout the ages with a mix of classic 2D levels inspired by the Blue Blur's Sega Genesis days and fast-paced 3D levels that feel like they were lifted directly from the Sonic Adventure games on the Dreamcast.

The other campaign is an all-new storyline where you play as Sonic's anti-hero counterpart, Shadow. Similar to Sonic's campaign, Shadow's stages play out across 2D and 3D arenas, but they feel different thanks to the powers you can unlock to help you overcome various obstacles in your way. This Amazon Black Friday deal is a great chance to add the game to your library for cheap.

The $20 discount is available at Amazon, Best Buy, and Target.

Sonic the Hedgehog Black Friday Game Deals

A few other Sonic games are also on sale for Black Friday if you feel like building a small library of speedy adventures, including Sonic Frontiers, which is a massive open world game that gives Sonic a big playground to speed around in, titanic boss fights, and a soundtrack that is incredibly metal. For a more classic Sonic feel, check out Sonic Origins Plus and Sonic Superstars, or you can get both Sonic Mania and Team Sonic Racing in a bundle deal for Switch.

item.title: Upgrade Your Home Theater With These Black Friday Soundbar Deals
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/upgrade-your-home-theater-with-these-black-friday-soundbar-deals/1100-6528000/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

If you want to upgrade your home theater ahead of the holidays, both Best Buy and Amazon are offering great soundbar discounts for Black Friday. Whether you're searching for something premium or entry-level, there are some excellent deals to check out. One of our favorite deals is for the Samsung HW-C450 2.1 Channel Soundbar, as it’s listed for just $138 (was $198) and it should make a nice addition to most home theaters. Currently own a soundbar and want to make a serious upgrade? You’ll find a $600 Samsung soundbar discounted to $330.

Here’s a closer look at five of our favorite Black Friday soundbar deals, and for even more options, check out all the soundbar deals at Amazon and Best Buy.

After you've browsed the soundbar deals, take a moment to check out GameSpot's Black Friday hub for discounts on video games, anime, Lego sets, and much more.

Samsung HW-C450 2.1 Channel Soundbar

$138 (was $198)

The Samsung HW-C450 2.1 Channel Soundbar is a solid entry point for people seeking an upgrade to their built-in TV speakers. For just $138, it gets you a soundbar, wireless subwoofer, support for DTS Virtual:X, and an adaptive sound feature that automatically optimizes your audio based on the content. There’s also a game mode for improved directional audio. Toss in a remote that works with both Samsung TVs and your soundbar, Bluetooth connectivity, and a bass boost option to enhance the sound of explosions, and the HW-C450 is a great choice during Black Friday.

Samsung HW-C400/ZA 2.0 Channel C-Series Soundbar

$90 (was $120)

With a built-in subwoofer, support for Dolby Audio and DTS, and a useful “night mode” that reduces bass levels, the awkwardly named Samsung HW-C400/ZA is a decent choice at this new low price. The built-in subwoofer is especially nice for small spaces that might not have room for a wireless subwoofer.

Bose TV Soundbar

$199 (was $279)

This compact Bose soundbar is just 24 inches long, but its list of features is more impressive than you’d expect. Along with two angled full-range drivers for booming spatial audio and crisp dialogue, there’s a dedicated “dialogue mode” you can enable to make it easier to pick out words during quiet scenes. Beyond connecting to your TV, the soundbar supports Bluetooth connections--consider syncing it with your phone for your next party.

Samsung HW-Q600C 3.1.2 Channel Q-Series Soundbar

$330 (was $600)

This is one of our favorite deals for a premium soundbar, as it’s hard to beat the $270 price cut. Along with a wireless subwoofer, this soundbar supports Dolby Atmos, Q-Symphony, and offers a Game Mode Pro setting that improves its 360-degree audio. Toss in a nifty remote that works with both Samsung TVs and this soundbar, adaptive sound support for clearer dialogue, and easy setup with HDMI eARC, and it's easy to see why this is one of our favorite soundbar deals of Black Friday.

Vizio V-Series 2.0 Compact Soundbar

$55 (was $80)

At just 24 inches long, this Vizio is a good size for small setups. It’s also great for shoppers on a budget, as it packs in some great specs despite a price tag of just over $50. With support for Dolby Audio and DTS Virtual:X plus two full-range speakers, it should be a big improvement over most built-in TV speakers.

The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom is one of the Switch's must-play games, and now it's available for its lowest price yet at major retailers. Best Buy and Target have Tears of the Kingdom's physical edition for only $40, saving you $30. Tears of the Kingdom is part of Nintendo's official Black Friday lineup, but the expectation was that it would cost $50. Like many Nintendo games, Tears of the Kingdom is rarely marked down, so we wouldn't be surprised if retailers sold out before Black Friday sales end. Especially because it will be a popular choice for holiday shoppers who pick up a Switch console bundle for $75 off.

The extra $10 off is a nice surprise, though you could possibly save even more. Walmart will have Tears of the Kingdom for $30 tomorrow, November 25, at 9 AM PT / 12 PM ET. The deal coincides with the launch of Walmart's Black Friday week deals. The catch here is that the offer is exclusive to paid Walmart+ subscribers until 2 PM PT / 5 PM ET. There's a very good chance it sells out before the deal opens up to everyone, but if you have a subscription already, make sure to check Walmart's listing when the sale begins to snag a copy.

It's worth noting Walmart+ is only $49/year right now thanks to a 50%-off promotion. Along with early access to sales events, subscribers get free two-day shipping on orders placed online, same-day delivery from your local store, a Paramount+ subscription, and other nice perks.

The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom

$40 (was $70)

The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom is not just one of the best Switch games, it's one of the greatest all-time games. The follow-up to the similarly incredible Breath of the Wild expanded the open world to stretch above and below Hyrule and introduced brilliant new building and physics systems. With Link's Ultrahand ability, you can manipulate objects and cobble together vehicles, bridges, and other contraptions. Breath of the Wild already offered an impressive degree of freedom, but Tears of the Kingdom takes it a step further. There's no one "right" way to solve the game's many clever puzzles, and that's what makes this sprawling adventure so thoroughly engaging for many dozens, if not hundreds, of hours.

item.title: A New Victrix Pro KO Leverless FIght Stick Is Coming Soon, Preorders Available Now
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/a-new-victrix-pro-ko-leverless-fight-stick-is-coming-soon-preorders-available-now/1100-6527987/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

As leverless fight stick controllers have become popular among fighting game players, more companies have entered the market with their own all-button models. The newest challenger in the space is the upcoming Victrix Pro KO Leverless controller from Turtle Beach. Priced at $250, this will be released on December 20 in PlayStation and Xbox models, and preorders are available now.

Turtle Beach Victrix Pro KO Leverless Fight Stick

$250 | Releases December 20

While this isn't the first Victrix levelerless fight stick, the Victrix Pro KO is the thinnest and lightest model in the lineup. That said, it doesn't skimp on durability, featuring a high-quality aluminum top plate and swappable MX Speed Silver RGB button switches. The stick features 16 main buttons with a layout optimized by fighting game legend Momochi--though all inputs are remappable, and there are four extra button slots if you want to shift the layout.

The Victrix Pro KO comes in two models: A PlayStation version that supports PS5, PS4, and PC, and an Xbox model that works with Xbox Series X|S, Xbox One, and PC. Both launch on December 20 for $250--which is comparatively low for premium-level leverless fight sticks. Preorders are available at Amazon.

Leverless fight sticks swap out a joystick for a set of four directional buttons. While it takes some getting used to for those who learned on a traditional fighting stick, leverless models are gaining popularity, as the dedicated directional keys make it easier to perform special moves and combos that require exact button inputs. Some players also find leverless fight sticks to be more comfortable and ergonomic, as there's reduced strain on your wrists when using one.

If you're interested in a leverless fight stick but don't want to wait for the Victrix Pro KO's December 20 launch date, you could opt for the Victrix Pro FS-12 instead, which is compatible with PC, PS5, and PS4. It has a bulkier design than the Victrix Pro KO and is more expensive at $400, but if you act fast, you can grab one for just $320, thanks to Amazon's Black Friday sale. If you'd prefer something more traditional, there is also a Victrix Pro FS model that includes a joystick. Both models are available in white or purple color options.

Alternatively, there's the Razer Kitsune for PS5 and PC. This is a premium leverless fight stick, but unlike the bulky Victrix Pro FS models, it features a compact form factor that's easy to slip into a backpack and transport to a fighting game tournament. Normally, the Razer Kitsune costs $300, but you can pick one up at Amazon for just $250 during Black Friday.

item.title: Thieves Allegedly Stole A Truck Packed With $1.5 Million in Oculus Headsets
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/thieves-allegedly-stole-a-truck-packed-with-1-5-million-in-oculus-headsets/1100-6528002/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Six men have been indicted for allegedly stealing a number of trucks, including one packed with $1.5 million in Oculus headsets, 404 Media reports.

According to court documents, the men watched distribution facilities throughout the Midwest and Southeastern US, following semi-trucks as they left the facilities. When the drivers of the hauling truck stopped to refuel, the men would steal the truck and trailer, connect the trailer to their own semi, and leave the stolen one. They also would "paint over any logos and/or identifying numbers on the stolen trailer, and use different license plates in an effort to conceal the identity of the trailer and evade law enforcement detection.

Two of the men "located a semi-tractor trailer that left the Louisville, Kentucky facility laden with Oculus reality goggles valued at approximately $1.5 million," according to the documents. Throughout 2022, the crew also snatched one truck stocked with $940,000 in Microsoft products, another with Sony products, and a third with Harman-JBL products worth $530,000. The value of the Sony products was not specified in the indictment. The heists continued into 2023, with the crew grabbing trucks stocking CF Moto ATVs and products from Victoria's Secret and Bath and Body Works products valued at $1 million.

Interestingly, seven men were arrested in Grapevine, Texas this week for stealing similar merch, though they stole directly from warehouses rather than trucks.

item.title: Microsoft Wants Edge To Be Your Gaming Browser With Edge Game Assist
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/microsoft-wants-edge-to-be-your-gaming-browser-with-edge-game-assist/1100-6528001/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Whether you're pulling up information about optimizing a build in Diablo 4, looking for a walkthrough for Rise of the Golden Idol, or can't figure out how to nail a combo in Street Fighter 6, the internet is an indispensable tool when gaming. Microsoft has introduced a new feature called Game Assist to its Edge browser that the company hopes will make it your number one gaming companion.

Game Assist is a "game-optimized" version of Edge that can appear as part of the Windows Game Bar that pops up when you hit WinKey+G or press the Xbox button on your Xbox game pad. When you activate the Game Assist browser, it will appear as part of the Game Bar overlay and can be pinned to your screen to have it hover over your game. You can also set transparency so that it isn't quite as obtrusive when pinned. The key feature, though, is the "game-aware new tab page."

Right now, this only works with a short list of games, as the feature is currently in beta testing, but once it's available live, Microsoft intends for this game-aware New Tab page to automatically detect which game you're playing so that it can suggest game-specific guides for you to pull up. This version of Edge will have access to all of the same information that your Edge browser does, so any saved passwords, bookmarks, and so on will be present.

The list of games includes Baldur's Gate 3, Diablo IV, Minecraft, Roblox, Overwatch 2, Valorant, Fortnite, Hellblade 2: Senua's Saga, and League of Legends.

There's an important caveat to all of this, though. You have to be willing to use the Windows Game Bar, of course, but right now, you also have to obtain the Microsoft Edge Beta browser and make it your default browser. For many who have committed to Chrome, Firefox, or some other browser, that's going to be a non-starter. Microsoft hasn't clarified whether Edge will have to be the default browser in the full release. Microsoft's official page doesn't clarify what ways the browser is optimized for gaming, but it would presumably have the browser consuming less memory and optimizing how much of your processor it can use in any given moment.

Game Assist does sound like a useful tool. Having access to that Diablo IV build information on the same screen as my game, for example, would make the build process go significantly faster. Having a custom map up that shows the location of all the baubles that open-world games want you to collect sounds like an absolute blessing. However, the current requirements mean that most of us will be waiting until the feature sees full release. And even then, if the default browser requirement sticks around, it might be a feature accessed by very few gamers.

If you want to try the feature out right now, Microsoft offers a walkthrough for setup on the announcement page.
